body_content.explanation: abbreviation for Card Verification Value: a number on a credit card or debit card (= a card used for payment), usually three digits (= individual numbers) on the back of the card, that is used to prove that the person making the payment has the card in their possession:
examples: The full credit card number is reprinted in the signature box and at the end of the number is the CVV.
Sellers are prohibited from retaining CVV numbers for any longer than it takes to verify a given transaction.
